Radiographic Report - Hip Dysplasia Evaluation

Study Date: 400 days ago

Views: Ventrodorsal extended hip radiograph

Findings:

  • Bilateral shallow acetabulum
  • Bilateral femoral head subluxation (moderate)
  • Left hip: Norberg angle 95° (abnormal - should be >105°)
  • Right hip: Norberg angle 92° (abnormal)
  • Evidence of remodeling and secondary osteoarthritis
  • Osteophyte formation noted on both femoral necks

Impression: Bilateral hip dysplasia with secondary degenerative joint disease (moderate severity)

Recommendations: Medical management with NSAIDs, joint supplements, weight control, and low-impact exercise. Surgical options (FHO, THR) discussed with owner - elected for conservative management at this time.
